creditline: The Rebecca and Ben Field Endowment for Art Acquisition
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: long case with attached rounded rectangular inkwell; red, orange, and turquoise round beads and gems; crescent and star designs on one side; medallions with text on opposite side; wire filigree
text: A wandering Muslim scribe in Algeria may have tucked this pen box under his belt while perusing the countryside to offer his services. The long, rectangular case once held reed pens, and the small attached lidded jar contained ink. This elegant object is made of silver alloy, decorated with red and turquoise beads and stones, and on one side has five silver Algerian coins, minted in the first part of the 19th century.
title: Pen box
